Message.Msg: Hey YDK, Sorry I didn't get to your post, a few weeks ago. Look at the chart for CIE, Cobalt something. Optionmonster had their Heat Seeker find that someone bought 7,200 contracts April $27.50's Calls for $1. It's a crazy chart as it went from $20 to $30 in DAYS, then $20 to $24, then $20 to $28 and now seem to be in the uptrend. Haven't entered yet but I do like the chart for trading purposes. As for Yahoo, say Yahoo Japan is worth $6B(after tax) and AG is worth $14B(TRIPLE what they got after tax). $20B+10B(core max) $30B/1.18B share is $25.42. It's IMPOSSIBLE to hit $30 even as there simply isn't much left to add. Kind've funny that on Wednesday or Thursday I wondered when the never ending Apple rumors would be floated and sure enough the buyout rumors are back yet again.

Topic.Title: Yahoo Best Way To Participate In The Alibaba IPO

Message.Msg: I see that.

Message.Title: Wall Street Waking Up To Yahoo's Alibaba Holding
Message.Msg: On February 4, 2013, I wrote an article titled "Yahoo May Be A Nice Way to Participate in the Alibaba IPO." Shortly thereafter, Cantor Fitzgerald upgraded Yahoo (YHOO) stating: "The analysts raised their target price for YHOO to $26 from $21, after adjusting the Alibaba/YHOO Japan valuation on new disclosures." Barclays Capital also issued an upgrade stating: Alibaba's valuation has probably risen to $55 billion from the $40 billion at which the company raised capital back in Q3 of last year, writes DiClemente, increasing the value to YHOO! by $2.23 billion to $8.98 billion. CNBC even highlighted the issue on Squawk in the Street. "Barclays upgrading YHOO saying markets underestimating the value of the stakes in Alibaba"

Topic.Title: What's your take if MSFT offer YHOO ( 1 share of MSFT Stock and $10.00 Cash) ??

Message.Msg: Color me simple minded, but WHY would tech companies like MSFT or Apple or Comcast or Samsung be interested in buying a media company like Yahoo?? Yahoo's business model is "We sell ads." right there in black and white in the 10-K. And besides, WHY is there such a desire to create buy-out buzz?? Yahoo has a good price to book, has plenty of cash, has 100% gain since bottoming out in 2009. Now if they used some of that cash for dividends this would be a nice stable medium to long term hold media company. What's not to like??

Topic.Title: Wall Street Waking Up To Yahoo's Alibaba Holding

Message.Msg: The Barclays article defines an estimated value for the YHOO Alibaba holdings of $55 billion, up from $40 billion in Q3 2012. That is a 37.5% increase in less than one year. It also states the increase to YHOO being between $2.23 billion and $8.98 billion. YHOO has 1.1 billion shares outstanding, so the value per share is between $2.00 and $8.16, a wide range yes, but a wide range on the upside. It is worth noting that the Cantor Fitzgerald estimate was increased by $5 from $21 to $26, which is essentially the mid-point between Barclays' estimate of an increase of $2.00 to $8.16.
